original: Gopakamoggallānasutta

translated: With Gopaka Moggallāna

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—

translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā ānando rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe aciraparinibbute bhagavati.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmai ānandaḥ rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe acira parinibbute bhagavati
translated: Once the Venerable Ānanda was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary, not long after the Blessed One had attained final nirvana.

original: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto rājagahaṁ paṭisaṅkhārāpeti rañño pajjotassa āsaṅkamāno.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehiputto rājagaham paṭisaṅkhārāpeti raññaḥ pajjotassa āsaṅkamānaḥ
translated: At that time King Ajātasattu of Magadha, the son of the Videhi princess, was preparing to attack the Vajjis, fearing that they might attack him first.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya rājagaham piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, in the morning, the Venerable Ānanda dressed and, taking bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.

original: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ ānandassa etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to him:

original: “atippago kho tāva rājagahe piṇḍāya carituṁ.🔽Yannūnāhaṁ yena gopakamoggallānassa brāhmaṇassa kammanto, yena gopakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
analyzed: atippago kho tāva rājagahe piṇḍāya caritu  yat nūna aham yena gopakamoggallānassa brāhmaṇassa kammantaḥ yena gopakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upasaṅkameyyanti
translated: “It’s too early to wander for alms in Rājagaha. 🔽Let me go to the brahmin Gopaka Moggallāna’s field to see if the brahmin is plowing his field.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena gopakamoggallānassa brāhmaṇassa kammanto, yena gopakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ yena gopakamoggallānassa brāhmaṇassa kammantaḥ yena gopakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: So he went to the brahmin Gopaka Moggallāna’s field to see if the brahmin was plowing his field.

original: Addasā kho gopakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā kho gopakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ āyasmantam ānandam dūratas u āgacchanta
translated: The brahmin Gopaka Moggallāna saw Venerable Ānanda coming in the distance,

original: Disvāna āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: disvānaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: and he said to him,

original: “etu kho bhavaṁ ānando.
analyzed: etu khalu bhavam ānandaḥ
translated: “Come, mister Ānanda.

original: Svāgataṁ bhoto ānandassa.🔽Cirassaṁ kho bhavaṁ ānando imaṁ pariyāyamakāsi yadidaṁ idhāgamanāya.
analyzed: svāgatam bhoto ānandassa  cirassam kho bhavam ānandaḥ imam pariyāyam akāsi yat idam idha āgamanāya
translated: Welcome, mister Ānanda.🔽It’s been a long time since you took the opportunity to come here.

original: Nisīdatu bhavaṁ ānando, idamāsanaṁ paññattan”ti.
analyzed: nisīdatu bhavam ānandaḥ idam āsanam paññattanti
translated: Please, mister Ānanda, take a seat. This seat is ready for you.”

original: Nisīdi kho āyasmā ānando paññatte āsane.
analyzed: nisīdi kho āyasmai ānando paññatte āsane
translated: Ānanda sat down on the seat they had prepared,

original: Gopakamoggallānopi kho brāhmaṇo aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: gopakamoggallānaḥ api kho brāhmaṇaḥ aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: and the brahmin Gopaka Moggallāna took a low seat and sat to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho gopakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu gopakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: When he had done so, he said to Ānanda,

original: “atthi nu kho, bho ānanda, ekabhikkhupi tehi dhammehi sabbenasabbaṁ sabbathāsabbaṁ samannāgato yehi dhammehi samannāgato so bhavaṁ gotamo ahosi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho”ti?
analyzed: atthi nu kho bho ānanda eka bhikkhu pi tehi dhammehi sabbena sabbam sabbathā sabbam samannāgataḥ yehi dhammehi samannāgataḥ saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ ahosi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ iti
translated: “Is there even a single monk who is fully accomplished in all things, in all aspects, as the Buddha was?”

original: “Natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi tehi dhammehi sabbenasabbaṁ sabbathāsabbaṁ samannāgato yehi dhammehi samannāgato so bhagavā ahosi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ eka bhikkhu pi tehi dhammehi sabbena sabbam sabbathā sabbam samannāgataḥ yehi dhammehi samannāgataḥ saḥ bhagavā ahosi araham sammāsambuddho
translated: “Brahmin, there is not a single bhikkhu who possesses in each and every way all those qualities that the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possessed.

original: So hi, brāhmaṇa, bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā, asañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā, anakkhātassa maggassa akkhātā, maggaññū, maggavidū, maggakovido;
analyzed: saḥ hi brāhmaṇa bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā a sañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā an akkhātassa maggassa akkhātā maggaññū magga vidū magga kovidaḥ
translated: For the Blessed One was the arouser of the unarisen path, the producer of the unproduced path, the declarer of the undeclared path; he was the knower of the path, the finder of the path, the one skilled in the path.

original: maggānugā ca pana etarahi sāvakā viharanti pacchā samannāgatā”ti.
analyzed: magga anugā ca pana etarahi sāvakāḥ viharanti pacchā samannāgatā ati
translated: But now his disciples abide following the path that was aroused by him, the path that was produced by him, the path that was declared by him; they abide having entered upon the way that was known, found, and realized by him.”

original: Ayañca hidaṁ āyasmato ānandassa gopakamoggallānena brāhmaṇena saddhiṁ antarākathā vippakatā ahosi.
analyzed: ayam ca hidam āyasmataḥ ānandassa gopakamoggallānena brāhmaṇena saddhim antarākathā vippakatā ahosi
translated: And this conversation between the venerable Ananda and the brahmin Gopaka Moggallana was interrupted.

original: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto rājagahe kammante anusaññāyamāno yena🔽gopakamoggallānassa brāhmaṇassa kammanto, yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: atha kho vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ rājagahe kammante anusaññāyamānaḥ yena  gopakamoggallānassa brāhmaṇassa kammantaḥ yena ayasmai ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: Then the brahmin Vassakara, chief minister of Magadha, while wandering and walking for exercise,

original: āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: āyasmatā ānandena saddhim sammodi
translated: went to the brahmin Gopaka Moggallana’s sacrificial mound. He exchanged greetings with the venerable Ananda and sat down to one side.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: and after exchanging polite and courteous greetings, he sat down to one side and said to Ven. Ānanda:🔽

original: “kāya nuttha, bho ānanda, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
analyzed: kāya nuttha bho ānanda etarahi kathāya sannisinnā kā ca pana vaḥ antarākathā vippakatā ati
translated: and after an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, he sat to one side. As he was sitting there, the brahmin Vassakara, the minister of Magadha, said to him, “Master Ananda, what is the reason, what is the cause why the thought occurs to monks, nuns, lay men, lay women: ‘Alas, we will be separated from those we love! Alas, we will be changed!’? “🔽“Brahmin, there are these four things that are wished for, desired, agreeable, and rarely gained in the world.🔽Which four?🔽Wealth.

original: “Idha maṁ, brāhmaṇa, gopakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo evamāha:
analyzed: idha ma brāhmaṇa gopakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ evam āha
translated: “Here, brahmin, some person is not wealthy, not rich, not of great property.

original: ‘atthi nu kho, bho ānanda, ekabhikkhupi tehi dhammehi sabbenasabbaṁ sabbathāsabbaṁ samannāgato yehi dhammehi samannāgato so bhavaṁ gotamo ahosi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho’ti.🔽Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, gopakamoggallānaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavocaṁ:
analyzed: atthi nu kho bho ānanda eka bhikkhu pi tehi dhammehi sabbena sabbam sabbathā sabbam samannāgataḥ yehi dhammehi samannāgataḥ saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ ahosi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ iti  evam vutte aha brāhmaṇa gopakamoggallānam brāhmaṇam etat avoca
translated: The thought occurs to him: ‘Oh, I wish I were not wealthy, not rich, not of great property!

original: ‘natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi tehi dhammehi sabbenasabbaṁ sabbathāsabbaṁ samannāgato yehi dhammehi samannāgato so bhagavā ahosi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ eka bhikkhu pi tehi dhammehi sabbena sabbam sabbathā sabbam samannāgataḥ yehi dhammehi samannāgataḥ saḥ bhagavā ahosi araham sammāsambuddho
translated: For if I were not wealthy, not rich, not of great property, people would not despise me.

original: So hi, brāhmaṇa, bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā, asañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā, anakkhātassa maggassa akkhātā, maggaññū, maggavidū, maggakovido;🔽maggānugā ca pana etarahi sāvakā viharanti pacchā samannāgatā’ti.
analyzed: saḥ hi brāhmaṇa bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā a sañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā an akkhātassa maggassa akkhātā maggaññū magga vidū magga kovidaḥ  magga anugā ca pana etarahi sāvakāḥ viharanti pacchā samannāgatā ati
translated: For he was the one who gave birth to the unproduced path, set rolling the unproduced path, declared the unproduced path. He was the knower of the path, the discoverer of the path, the one skilled in the path.

original: Ayaṁ kho no, brāhmaṇa, gopakamoggallānena brāhmaṇena saddhiṁ antarākathā vippakatā.
analyzed: ayam khalu naḥ brāhmaṇa gopakamoggallānena brāhmaṇena saddhim antarākathā vippaka tā
translated: And his disciples now abide following the path, after him, in conformity with him, as the disciples of the Lord Buddha Gotama abide following the Lord, after him, in conformity with him.”🔽“This was the conversation that was interrupted.

original: Atha tvaṁ anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: atha tvam anuppatto ti
translated: And now you have arrived.”

original: “Atthi nu kho, bho ānanda, ekabhikkhupi tena bhotā gotamena ṭhapito:
analyzed: atthi nu kho bho ānanda tena bhotā gotamena ṭhapito
translated: “Master Ananda, did Master Gotama declare to you a further true knowledge and vision,

original: ‘ayaṁ vo mamaccayena paṭisaraṇaṁ bhavissatī’ti, yaṁ tumhe etarahi paṭipādeyyāthā”ti?
analyzed: ayam vaḥ mamaccayena paṭisaraṇam bhavissati iti yam tumhe etarahi paṭipādeyyātha ati
translated: so that you now have a teacher other than Master Gotama?”

original: “Natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ṭhapito:
analyzed: natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ṭhapitaḥ
translated: “Brahmin, the Lord Buddha did not declare to us a further true knowledge and vision,

analyzed: ayam vaḥ mamaccayena paṭisaraṇam bhavissati iti yam mayam etarahi paṭipādeyyāma ati
translated: so that we now have a teacher other than the Lord Buddha.”

original: “Atthi pana, bho ānanda, ekabhikkhupi saṅghena sammato, sambahulehi therehi bhikkhūhi ṭhapito:
analyzed: atthi pana bho ānanda saṅghena sammataḥ sambahulehi therehi bhikkhūhi ṭhapitaḥ

analyzed: ayam naḥ bhagavataḥ accayena paṭisaraṇam bhavissati iti yam tumhe etarahi paṭipādeyyātha ati  natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ saṅghena sammataḥ sambahulehi therehi bhikkhūhi ṭhapito
translated: “But, Reverend Ānanda, is there even a single monk agreed upon by the community of monks as the one who, after the passing of the Lord, will be your refuge?”

translated: “There is no single monk agreed upon by the community of monks as the one who, after the passing of the Lord, will be our refuge.”

analyzed: evam a paṭisaraṇe ca pana bho ānanda kaḥ hetu sāmaggiyā ati

translated: “But, Reverend Ānanda, is there even a single monk appointed by the Lord,

translated: “There’s a training rule laid down by the Buddha, the Perfected and fully Awakened One, for the monks. The Monastic Code has been recited.

translated: We invite the one who is senior to us.

translated: If a monk has an offense or a transgression while that is being recited, we deal with him according to the Teaching and the Monastic Law.

translated: “Is there even a single monk whom you now respect, revere, and honor, and on whom you now live in dependence looking to him for spiritual life?”

original: “Natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi yaṁ mayaṁ etarahi sakkaroma garuṁ karoma mānema pūjema; sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya viharāmā”ti.🔽“‘Atthi nu kho, bho ānanda, ekabhikkhupi tena bhotā gotamena ṭhapito—
analyzed: natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ eka bhikkhu pi yam mayam etarahi sakkaroma garum karoma mānema pūjema sakkatvā garum katvā upanissāya viharāma ati  atthi nu kho bho ānanda tena bhotā gotamena ṭhapito
translated: “No, brahmin, there is no single monk whom we now respect, revere, and honor, and on whom we now live in dependence looking to him for spiritual life.”

original: ayaṁ vo mamaccayena paṭisaraṇaṁ bhavissatīti yaṁ tumhe etarahi paṭipādeyyāthā’ti—🔽iti puṭṭho samāno ‘natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ṭhapito—
analyzed: ayam vaḥ mamaccayena paṭisaraṇam bhavissati iti yam tumhe etarahi paṭipādeyyātha ati  iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena ṭhapitaḥ
translated: “‘Is there even a single monk who has been appointed by the Lord Buddha as the Saṅgha’s refuge after his passing, so that you could now train in accordance with him?’

original: ayaṁ vo mamaccayena paṭisaraṇaṁ bhavissatīti yaṁ mayaṁ etarahi paṭipādeyyāmā’ti vadesi;
analyzed: ayam vaḥ mamaccayena paṭisaraṇam bhavissati iti yam mayam etarahi paṭipādeyyāma ati vadesi
translated: “When asked this, you say, ‘No, brahmin, there is no single monk who has been appointed by the Lord Buddha as the Saṅgha’s refuge after his passing, so that we could now train in accordance with him.’🔽“But, Master Ānanda, when asked

original: ‘atthi pana, bho ānanda, ekabhikkhupi saṅghena sammato, sambahulehi therehi bhikkhūhi ṭhapito—
analyzed: atthi pana bho ānanda saṅghena sammataḥ sambahulehi therehi bhikkhūhi ṭhapitaḥ
translated: ‘But is there a single monk who has been approved by the Sangha and appointed by a number of senior monks,

original: ayaṁ no bhagavato accayena paṭisaraṇaṁ bhavissatīti yaṁ tumhe etarahi paṭipādeyyāthā’ti—
analyzed: ayam naḥ bhagavataḥ accayena paṭisaraṇam bhavissati iti yam tumhe etarahi paṭipādeyyātha ati
translated: saying, “This is our refuge after the Blessed One has gone,” and who you now follow?’

original: iti puṭṭho samāno ‘natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi saṅghena sammato, sambahulehi therehi bhikkhūhi ṭhapito—
analyzed: iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ saṅghena sammataḥ sambahulehi therehi bhikkhūhi ṭhapitaḥ
translated: When asked this, you said, ‘No, brahmin, there is no single monk who has been approved by the Sangha and appointed by a number of senior monks,

original: ayaṁ no bhagavato accayena paṭisaraṇaṁ bhavissatīti yaṁ mayaṁ etarahi paṭipādeyyāmā’ti vadesi;
analyzed: ayam naḥ bhagavataḥ accayena paṭisaraṇam bhavissati iti yam mayam etarahi paṭipādeyyāma ati vadesi
translated: saying, “This is our refuge after the Blessed One has gone,” and who we now follow.’

original: ‘atthi nu kho, bho ānanda, ekabhikkhupi yaṁ tumhe etarahi sakkarotha garuṁ karotha mānetha pūjetha; sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya viharathā’ti—
analyzed: atthi nu kho bho ānanda eka bhikkhu pi yam tumhe etarahi sakkarotha garum karotha mānetha pūjetha sakkatvā garum katvā upanissāya viharatha ati
translated: ‘But is there a single monk whom you now respect, revere, and esteem, relying on whom you live?’

original: iti puṭṭho samāno ‘natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi yaṁ mayaṁ etarahi sakkaroma garuṁ karoma mānema pūjema; sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya viharāmā’ti vadesi.
analyzed: iti puṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ na atthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ eka bhikkhu pi yam mayam etarahi sakkaroma garum karoma mānema pūjema sakkatvā garum katvā upanissāya viharāma ati vadesi
translated: When asked this, you said, ‘No, brahmin, there is no single monk whom we now respect, revere, and esteem, relying on whom we live.’

original: Imassa pana, bho ānanda, bhāsitassa kathaṁ attho daṭṭhabbo”ti?
analyzed: imassa pana bho ānanda bhāsitassa katham atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ ti
translated: What is the meaning of this statement?”

original: “Atthi kho, brāhmaṇa, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa pasādanīyā dhammā akkhātā.
analyzed: atthi kho brāhmaṇa tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa pasādanīyāḥ dhammāḥ akkhātā
translated: “Brahmin, the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened, has declared ten qualities inspiring confidence.

original: Yasmiṁ no ime dhammā saṁvijjanti taṁ mayaṁ etarahi sakkaroma garuṁ karoma mānema pūjema; sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya viharāma.
analyzed: yasmin no ime dhammā savijjanti tam mayam etarahi sakkaroma garum karoma mānema pūjema sakkatvā garum katvā upanissāya viharāma
translated: When these qualities are found in anyone among us, we honour, respect, revere, and venerate him, and live in dependence on him honouring and respecting him.

original: Katame dasa?
analyzed: katame dasa
translated: What are the ten?

original: Idha, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno, aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: idha brāhmaṇa bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: Here a bhikkhu is virtuous, he dwells restrained with the restraint of the Patimokkha, he is perfect in conduct and resort, and seeing fear in the slightest fault, he trains by undertaking the training precepts.

original: Bahussuto hoti sutadharo sutasannicayo.🔽Ye te dhammā ādikalyāṇā, majjhekalyāṇā, pariyosānakalyāṇā, sātthaṁ, sabyañjanaṁ,
analyzed: bahu sutaḥ hoti suta dharaḥ suta sannicayaḥ  ye te dhammā ādi kalyāṇā majjhe kalyāṇā pariyosāna kalyāṇā sā attha sa byañjana
translated: He is learned, one who has learned much, remembers what he has learned, and accumulates what he has learned.

original: kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ abhivadanti tathārūpāssa dhammā bahussutā
analyzed: kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam abhivadanti tathārūpāḥ sa dhammāḥ bahu sutā
translated: Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, which proclaim the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—such teachings as these he has learned much of, retained in mind, recited verbally, investigated mentally, and penetrated well by view.

original: honti dhātā vacasā paricitā manasānupekkhitā diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā.
analyzed: honti dhātā vacasā paricitāḥ manasā anupekkhitāḥ diṭṭhiyā suppaṭividdhā
translated: He has the view that what he has learned from his teachers has been well learned, and he examines the meaning of those teachings with wisdom.

original: Santuṭṭho hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārehi.🔽Catunnaṁ jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.🔽Anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko
analyzed: santuṭṭhaḥ hoti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārehi  catunnam jhānānam ābhicetasikānam diṭṭhadhamma sukha vihārānam nikāma lābhī hoti a kiccha lābhī a kasira lābhī  aneka vihitam iddhi vidham paccanubhoti ekaḥ api hutvā bahudhā hoti bahudhā api hutvā ekaḥ
translated: He is content with the four requisites—robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines for the sick—and with whatever else may be needed to support a renunciant life.🔽He attains the four jhānas—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind and include the attainment of one-pointedness of mind.

original: hoti; āvibhāvaṁ tirobhāvaṁ; tirokuṭṭaṁ tiropākāraṁ tiropabbataṁ asajjamāno gacchati,🔽seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṁ karoti, seyyathāpi udake; udakepi abhijjamāne
analyzed: hoti āvi bhāvam tiro bhāva tiro kuṭṭam tiro upākāram tiro pabbatam a sajjamānaḥ gacchati  seyyathā api ākāse pathaviyā api ummujja nimujjam karoti seyyathā api udake udake api abhijjamāne
translated: He wields the various kinds of psychic power: having been one, he becomes many; having been many, he becomes one; he appears and disappears; he goes unhindered through walls, through enclosures, through mountains, as though through space;

original: gacchati, seyyathāpi pathaviyaṁ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kamati, seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo;🔽imepi candimasūriye evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve pāṇinā parimasati parimajjati,
analyzed: gacchati seyyathā api pathaviye ākāse pi pallaṅkena kamati seyyathā api pakkhī sakuṇaḥ 🔽ime api candima sūriye eva mahiddhike eva mahā anubhāve pāṇinā parimasati parimajjati
translated: he dives in and out of the earth as though in water; he goes through water as though on dry land; he sits cross-legged in the sky; he touches and strokes with his hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful;🔽he exercises mastery with his body as far as the Brahmā world.

original: yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṁ vatteti.
analyzed: yāva brahma lokā api kāyena vasam vatta iti
translated: and he wields bodily mastery even as far as the Brahmā-world.

original: Dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇāti—dibbe ca mānuse ca, ye dūre santike ca.🔽Parasattānaṁ parapuggalānaṁ cetasā ceto paricca pajānāti.🔽Sarāgaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘sarāgaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkanta mānusikāya ubho sadde suṇāti dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike ca  para sattānam para puggalānam cetasā cetaḥ paricca pajānāti  sa rāgam vā cittam sa rāgam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: With the divine ear element, which is purified and surpasses the human, he hears both kinds of sounds, the divine and the human, those that are far as well as near.🔽He understands the minds of other beings, of other persons, having encompassed them with his own mind.🔽He understands a mind affected by lust as affected by lust

original: vītarāgaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘vītarāgaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: vīta rāgam vā cittam vīta rāgam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: and a mind unaffected by lust as unaffected by lust;

original: sadosaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘sadosaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,🔽vītadosaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘vītadosaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: sa dosam vā cittam sa dosam cittam iti pajānāti  vīta dosam vā cittam vīta dosam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: he understands a mind affected by hate as affected by hate🔽and a mind unaffected by hate as unaffected by hate;🔽he understands a mind affected by delusion as affected by delusion

original: samohaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘samohaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,🔽vītamohaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘vītamohaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: sa moham vā cittam sa moham cittam iti pajānāti  vīta moham vā cittam vīta moham cittam iti pajānāti
translated: and a mind unaffected by delusion as unaffected by delusion;🔽he understands a contracted mind as contracted

original: saṅkhittaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘saṅkhittaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,🔽vikkhittaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘vikkhittaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: saṅkhittam vā cittam saṅkhittam cittam iti pajānāti  vikkhittam vā cittam vikkhittam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: and a distracted mind as distracted;🔽he understands an exalted mind as exalted

original: mahaggataṁ vā cittaṁ ‘mahaggataṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: mahaggatam vā cittam mahaggatam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: and an unexalted mind as unexalted;

original: amahaggataṁ vā cittaṁ ‘amahaggataṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,🔽sauttaraṁ vā cittaṁ ‘sauttaraṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: a mahaggatam vā cittam a mahaggatam cittam iti pajānāti  sauttaram vā cittam sauttaram cittam iti pajānāti
translated: He knows a mind that is not great to be a mind that is not great.🔽He knows a mind with future aspirations to be a mind with future aspirations.

original: anuttaraṁ vā cittaṁ ‘anuttaraṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,🔽samāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘samāhitaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,🔽asamāhitaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘asamāhitaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: anuttaram vā cittam anuttaram cittam iti pajānāti  samāhitam vā cittam samāhitam cittam iti pajānāti  a samāhitam vā cittam a samāhitam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: He knows a mind without future aspirations to be a mind without future aspirations.🔽He knows a mind that is developed to be a mind that is developed.🔽He knows a mind that is undeveloped to be a mind that is undeveloped.

original: vimuttaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘vimuttaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti,
analyzed: vimuttam vā cittam vimuttam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: He knows a liberated mind to be a liberated mind.

original: avimuttaṁ vā cittaṁ ‘avimuttaṁ cittan’ti pajānāti.
analyzed: a vimuttam vā cittam a vimuttam cittam iti pajānāti
translated: He knows an unliberated mind to be an unliberated mind.🔽He recollects his manifold past abodes with their aspects and details.

original: Anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi🔽jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo vīsampi jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo🔽cattārīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi
analyzed: aneka vihitam pubbenivāsam anussarati seyyathidam ekam pi jātim dve pi jātiyaḥ tissaḥ api  jātiyo catasso pi jātiyaḥ pañca api jātiyaḥ dasa api jātiyaḥ vīsampi jātiyaḥ tisampi jātiyaḥ  cattārīsam pi jātiyaḥ paññāsam pi jātiyaḥ jāti satam pi jāti sahassam pi jāti sata sahassam pi
translated: He recollects one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births,

original: anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe: ‘amutrāsiṁ
analyzed: aneke api savaṭṭa kappe aneke api vivaṭṭa kappe aneke api savaṭṭa vivaṭṭa kappe amutra asi
translated: a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births, many eons of world-dissolution, many eons of world-evolution, many eons of world-dissolution and world-evolution: ‘There I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term;🔽and passing away from there, I reappeared elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a clan, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term; and passing away from there, I reappeared here.’ Thus with their aspects and details he recollects his manifold past abodes.

original: evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto,🔽so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ; tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī
analyzed: eva nāmaḥ evaṃgotto eva vaṇṇo evam āhāro eva sukha dukkha paṭisavedī evam āyu pariyanto  saḥ tatas cutaḥ amutra udapādi tatra apāsim eva nāmaḥ evaṃgottaḥ eva vaṇṇo evam āhāraḥ eva sukha dukkha ppaṭisavedī
translated: I had such and such a name, such and such a family, such and such a clan, such and such a food, experienced such and such pleasure and pain,🔽and had such and such a life span. Passing away from there, I was reborn elsewhere. Passing away from there, I was reborn here.

original: evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapanno’ti. Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ🔽pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
analyzed: evam āyu pariyantaḥ saḥ tatas cutaḥ idhu upapanno ti iti sa ākāram sa uddesam aneka vihita  pubbenivāsam anussarati
translated: Thus with their aspects and particulars I remember my manifold past abodes.

original: Dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
analyzed: dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate yathākammūpage satte pajānāti
translated: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, I see beings passing away and being reborn, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, and I understand how beings fare in accordance with their kamma.

original: Āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: āsavānam khayā anāsavam cetaḥ vimuttim paññā vimuttim diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati
translated: By realising for myself with direct knowledge, I enter upon and dwell in the deliverance of mind and deliverance by wisdom that are taintless with the destruction of the taints.

original: Ime kho, brāhmaṇa, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa pasādanīyā dhammā akkhātā.
analyzed: ime kho brāhmaṇa tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dasa pasādanīyāḥ dhammāḥ akkhātā
translated: “Brahmin, these are the ten inspiring qualities declared by the Blessed One who knows and sees, accomplished and fully enlightened.

original: Yasmiṁ no ime dhammā saṁvijjanti taṁ mayaṁ etarahi sakkaroma garuṁ karoma mānema pūjema; sakkatvā garuṁ katvā upanissāya viharāmā”ti.
analyzed: yasmin no ime dhammā savijjanti tam mayam etarahi sakkaroma garum karoma mānema pūjema sakkatvā garum katvā upanissāya viharāma ati
translated: Having respected, revered, honoured, and venerated them, we live in dependence on them.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto upanandaṁ senāpatiṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: evam vutte vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ upanandam senāpatim āmantesi
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Vassakara, chief minister of Magadha, addressed the general Upananda:

original: “Taṁ kiṁ maññati bhavaṁ senāpati yadime bhonto sakkātabbaṁ sakkaronti, garuṁ kātabbaṁ garuṁ karonti,🔽mānetabbaṁ mānenti, pūjetabbaṁ pūjenti”?
analyzed: tam kim maññati bhavam senāpati yat ime bhonto sakkātabbam sakkaronti garum kātabbam garum karonti  mānetabbam mānenti pūjetabbam pūjenti
translated: “What does Master Upananda think of those who respect, revere, honour, and venerate those who should be honoured?

original: “Tagghime bhonto sakkātabbaṁ sakkaronti, garuṁ kātabbaṁ garuṁ karonti, mānetabbaṁ mānenti, pūjetabbaṁ pūjenti.
analyzed: tat hi ime bhontaḥ sakkātabbam sakkaronti garum kātabbam garum karonti mānetabbam mānenti pūjetabbam pūjenti
translated: “Those who respect, revere, honour, and venerate those who should be honoured.

original: Imañca hi te bhonto na sakkareyyuṁ na garuṁ kareyyuṁ na māneyyuṁ na pūjeyyuṁ;
analyzed: iman ca hi te bhontaḥ na sakkareyyum na garum kareyyum na māneyyum na pūjeyyu
translated: But if those venerable ones did not respect, revere, honour, and venerate them,

original: atha kiñcarahi te bhonto sakkareyyuṁ garuṁ kareyyuṁ māneyyuṁ pūjeyyuṁ, sakkatvā garuṁ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā upanissāya vihareyyun”ti?
analyzed: atha kiñcarahi te bhonto sakkareyyum garum kareyyum māneyyum pūjeyyu sakkatvā garum katvā mānetvā pūjetvā upanissāya vihareyyunti
translated: then what else could they do but respect, revere, honour, and venerate them? Having respected, revered, honoured, and venerated them, they would live in dependence on them.”

original: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: Then the brahmin Vassakara, chief minister of Magadha, said to the venerable Ananda:

original: “kahaṁ pana bhavaṁ ānando etarahi viharatī”ti?
analyzed: kaham pana bhavan ānandaḥ etarahi viharati iti
translated: Then Vassakāra, the chief minister of Magadha, said to Ven. Ānanda, “Where is Master Ānanda staying at present?”

original: “Veḷuvane khohaṁ, brāhmaṇa, etarahi viharāmī”ti.
analyzed: veḷuvane kha uha brāhmaṇaḥ etarahi viharāmi iti
translated: “At present, brahman, I’m staying in the Bamboo Grove.”

original: “Kacci pana, bho ānanda, veḷuvanaṁ ramaṇīyañceva appasaddañca appanigghosañca vijanavātaṁ manussarāhasseyyakaṁ paṭisallānasāruppan”ti?
analyzed: kacci pana bho ānanda veḷuvanam ramaṇīyam ca iva appasaddam ca appanigghosam ca vijana vātam manussa rāhasseyyakam paṭisallāna sāruppanti
translated: “Is the Bamboo Grove delightful, quiet, with a minimum of sound & bustle, with few noises, far from people, secluded from human beings, well-fitted for seclusion?”

original: “Taggha, brāhmaṇa, veḷuvanaṁ ramaṇīyañceva appasaddañca appanigghosañca vijanavātaṁ manussarāhasseyyakaṁ paṭisallānasāruppaṁ, yathā taṁ tumhādisehi rakkhakehi gopakehī”ti.
analyzed: tat ha brāhmaṇa veḷuvanam ramaṇīyañca iva appasaddañca appanigghosañca vijana vātam manussa rāhasseyyakam paṭisallāna sāruppa yathā tam tumhādisehi rakkhakehi gopakehi iti
translated: “Yes, brahman, the Bamboo Grove is delightful, quiet, with a minimum of sound & bustle, with few noises, far from people, secluded from human beings, well-fitted for seclusion. It’s because of the protection & security provided by you, brahman, that the Bamboo Grove is delightful, quiet, with a minimum of sound & bustle, with few noises, far from people, secluded from human beings, well-fitted for seclusion.”

original: “Taggha, bho ānanda, veḷuvanaṁ ramaṇīyañceva appasaddañca appanigghosañca vijanavātaṁ manussarāhasseyyakaṁ paṭisallānasāruppaṁ, yathā taṁ bhavantehi jhāyīhi jhānasīlīhi.
analyzed: tat ha bho ānanda veḷuvanam ramaṇīyam ca iva appasaddam ca appanigghosam ca vijana vātam manussa rāhasseyyakam paṭisallāna sāruppa yathā tam bhavantehi jhāyīhi jhāna sīlīhi
translated: “Yes, Master Ānanda, the Bamboo Grove is delightful, quiet, with a minimum of sound & bustle, with few noises, far from people, secluded from human beings, well-fitted for seclusion. It’s because of the meditators that the Bamboo Grove is delightful, quiet, with a minimum of sound & bustle, with few noises, far from people, secluded from human beings, well-fitted for seclusion.

original: Jhāyino ceva bhavanto jhānasīlino ca.
analyzed: jhāyinaḥ ca iva bhavantaḥ jhānasīlinaḥ ca
translated: You are meditators, Master Ānanda, and you practice meditation.”

original: Ekamidāhaṁ, bho ānanda, samayaṁ so bhavaṁ gotamo vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
analyzed: ekam id āha bho ānanda samayam saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāya
translated: On one occasion the Lord was staying at Vesālī in the Great Wood in the Hall with the Peaked Roof.

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, bho ānanda, yena mahāvanaṁ kūṭāgārasālā yena so bhavaṁ gotamo tenupasaṅkamiṁ.
analyzed: atha khvā āha bho ānanda yena mahā vanam kūṭāgāra sālā yena saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then I went to the Great Wood, to the Hall with the Peaked Roof, to see the Lord.

original: Tatra ca pana so bhavaṁ gotamo anekapariyāyena jhānakathaṁ kathesi.
analyzed: tatra ca pana saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ aneka pariyāyena jhāna katham kathesi
translated: And there the Lord spoke in many ways on the theme of meditation.

original: Jhāyī ceva so bhavaṁ gotamo ahosi jhānasīlī ca.
analyzed: jhāyī ca iva saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ ahosi jhānasīlī ca
translated: The Lord was a meditator, and he praised meditation.

original: Sabbañca pana so bhavaṁ gotamo jhānaṁ vaṇṇesī”ti.
analyzed: sabbam ca pana saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ jhānam vaṇṇesi iti
translated: He spoke in praise of all meditation.”

original: “Na ca kho, brāhmaṇa, so bhagavā sabbaṁ jhānaṁ vaṇṇesi, napi so bhagavā sabbaṁ jhānaṁ na vaṇṇesīti.
analyzed: na ca kho brāhmaṇa saḥ bhagavā sabbam jhānam vaṇṇesi na pi saḥ bhagavā sabbam jhānam na vaṇṇesi iti
translated: “Brahmin, the Lord did not praise all meditation, nor did he dispraise all meditation.

original: Kathaṁ rūpañca, brāhmaṇa, so bhagavā jhānaṁ na vaṇṇesi?
analyzed: katham rūpam ca brāhmaṇa saḥ bhagavā jhānam na vaṇṇesi
translated: How did he not praise it?

original: Idha, brāhmaṇa, ekacco kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena, uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti;
analyzed: idha brāhmaṇaḥ ekaccaḥ kāma rāga pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāma rāga paretena uppannassa ca kāma rāgassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti
translated: Here, brahmin, someone dwells with his mind obsessed by sensual lust, a prey to sensual lust, and he does not understand as it really is the escape from arisen sensual lust.

original: so kāmarāgaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.
analyzed: saḥ kāma rāgayā iva antaram karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati
translated: He meditates, he meditates earnestly, he meditates intensely, he meditates continuously, he meditates with a concentrated mind, he meditates with an unscattered mind, he meditates with a composed mind, he meditates with an undisturbed mind, he meditates with an inwardly disciplined mind, he meditates with a well-composed mind.

original: Byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpādaparetena, uppannassa ca byāpādassa nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti;🔽so byāpādaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.
analyzed: byāpāda pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpāda paretena uppannassa ca byāpādassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti  saḥ byāpādayā iva antaram karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati
translated: He dwells with a mind obsessed by ill will, overwhelmed by ill will, and he does not understand as it really is the escape from arisen ill will.🔽He meditates, he meditates earnestly, he meditates intensely, he meditates continuously, he meditates with a concentrated mind, he meditates with an unscattered mind, he meditates with a composed mind, he meditates with an undisturbed mind, he meditates with an inwardly disciplined mind, he meditates with a well-composed mind.

original: Thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati thinamiddhaparetena, uppannassa ca thinamiddhassa nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti;🔽so thinamiddhaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.
analyzed: thinamiddha pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati thinamiddha paretena uppannassa ca thinamiddhassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti  saḥ thinam iddhayā iva antaram karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati
translated: He dwells with a mind obsessed by sloth and torpor, overwhelmed by sloth and torpor, and he does not understand as it really is the escape from arisen sloth and torpor.🔽He meditates, he meditates earnestly, he meditates intensely, he meditates continuously, he meditates with a concentrated mind, he meditates with an unscattered mind, he meditates with a composed mind, he meditates with an undisturbed mind, he meditates with an inwardly disciplined mind, he meditates with a well-composed mind.

original: Uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati uddhaccakukkuccaparetena, uppannassa ca uddhaccakukkuccassa nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti;
analyzed: uddhacca kukkucca pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati uddhacca kukkucca paretena uppannassa ca uddhacca kukkuccassa nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti
translated: He dwells with a mind obsessed by restlessness and remorse, overwhelmed by restlessness and remorse, and he does not understand as it really is the escape from arisen restlessness and remorse.

original: so uddhaccakukkuccaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.
analyzed: saḥ uddhacca kukkuccayā iva antaram karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati
translated: He meditates, he meditates earnestly, he meditates intensely, he meditates continuously, he meditates without being distracted.

original: Vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati vicikicchāparetena, uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇaṁ yathābhūtaṁ nappajānāti;
analyzed: vicikicchā pariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati vicikicchā paretena uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇam yathābhūtam na pajānāti
translated: He lives with doubt in the Sangha, with uncertainty in the Sangha, and he does not understand as it really is the escape from the arisen doubt.

original: so vicikicchaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati.
analyzed: saḥ vicikicchayā iva antaram karitvā jhāyati pajjhāyati nijjhāyati apajjhāyati
translated: He meditates, he meditates earnestly, he meditates intensely, he meditates continuously, he meditates without being distracted.

original: Evarūpaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, so bhagavā jhānaṁ na vaṇṇesi.
analyzed: evarūpam kho brāhmaṇa saḥ bhagavā jhānam na vaṇṇesi
translated: This is the kind of meditation the Buddha did not praise.

original: Kathaṁ rūpañca, brāhmaṇa, so bhagavā jhānaṁ vaṇṇesi?🔽Idha, brāhmaṇa, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …
analyzed: katham rūpam ca brāhmaṇa saḥ bhagavā jhānam vaṇṇesi  idha brāhmaṇa bhikkhu vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati  vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam
translated: And what kind of meditation did the Buddha praise?🔽It’s when a monk, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.

original: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ …
analyzed: tatiyam jhānam
translated: With the stilling of directed thoughts and evaluations, he enters and remains in the second absorption, which has internal placidity and unification of mind and possesses the rapture and bliss born of concentration, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.🔽With the fading away of rapture, he remains equanimous, mindful, and alert, and senses bliss with the body, while entering and remaining in the third absorption of which the noble ones declare: ‘He is equanimous, mindful, one who dwells blissfully.’

original: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: he enters and remains in the fourth jhāna.

original: Evarūpaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, so bhagavā jhānaṁ vaṇṇesī”ti.
analyzed: evarūpam kho brāhmaṇa saḥ bhagavā jhānam vaṇṇesi iti
translated: This is the kind of jhāna the Blessed One praises.”

original: “Gārayhaṁ kira, bho ānanda, so bhavaṁ gotamo jhānaṁ garahi, pāsaṁsaṁ pasaṁsi.
analyzed: gārayham kira bho ānanda saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ jhānam garahi pāsasam pasasi
translated: “So the Lord Gotama disparages the kind of jhāna that the brahmins praise and extols the kind of jhāna that they disparage.

original: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bho ānanda, gacchāma;
analyzed: handa ca dāni maya bho ānanda gacchāma
translated: Now, Master Ananda, we depart.

original: bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: bahu kitcā mayam bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: We are busy and have much to do.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tva brāhmaṇa kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Brahmin, you may go at your own convenience.”

original: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto āyasmato ānandassa bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho vassakāraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ magadha mahāmattaḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: Then the brahmin Vassakara, chief minister of Magadha, having delighted and rejoiced in the venerable Ananda’s words, rose from his seat and departed.

original: Atha kho gopakamoggallāno brāhmaṇo acirapakkante vassakāre brāhmaṇe magadhamahāmatte āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu gopakamoggallānaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ acira pakkante vassakāre brāhmaṇe magadha mahāmatte āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: Then, not long after he had left, the brahmin Gopaka Moggallana said to the venerable Ananda:

original: “yaṁ no mayaṁ bhavantaṁ ānandaṁ apucchimhā taṁ no bhavaṁ ānando na byākāsī”ti.
analyzed: yam naḥ mayam bhavantam ānandam apucchimha tam naḥ bhavam ānandaḥ na byākāsi iti
translated: “We asked Master Ananda about the kind of jhana that the brahmins praise, and he did not explain it as the kind of jhana that the brahmins praise.

original: “Nanu te, brāhmaṇa, avocumhā:
analyzed: nanu te brāhmaṇa avocumhā
translated: “But, brahmin, didn’t I say to you:

original: ‘natthi kho, brāhmaṇa, ekabhikkhupi tehi dhammehi sabbenasabbaṁ sabbathāsabbaṁ samannāgato yehi dhammehi samannāgato so bhagavā ahosi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: natthi kho brāhmaṇaḥ eka bhikkhu pi tehi dhammehi sabbena sabbam sabbathā sabbam samannāgataḥ yehi dhammehi samannāgataḥ saḥ bhagavā ahosi araham sammāsambuddho
translated: ‘Brahmin, there is not a single monk who has all those qualities that the Blessed Lord had when he was a fully-enlightened Buddha.

original: So hi, brāhmaṇa, bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā, asañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā, anakkhātassa maggassa akkhātā, maggaññū, maggavidū, maggakovido.
analyzed: saḥ hi brāhmaṇa bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā a sañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā an akkhātassa maggassa akkhātā maggaññū magga vidū magga kovidaḥ
translated: For the Blessed Lord was the discoverer of a path not known before, and he was the explainer of a truth not known before. He was the one who knew and the one who saw, of great wisdom, great energy, great power, great mindfulness, great concentration, great understanding, great steadfastness, great compassion, great forbearance, great gentleness, great purity.

original: Maggānugā ca pana etarahi sāvakā viharanti pacchā samannāgatā’”ti.🔽Gopakamoggallānasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: magga anugā ca pana etarahi sāvakāḥ viharanti pacchā samannāgatā ati 🔽gopakamoggallāna suttam niṭṭhitam aṭṭhama
translated: And his disciples now live following the path he discovered and taught.’🔽The Discussion with Gopaka Moggallana is finished.
